title: Urban Innovation - Minor
description: This Urban Innovation minor provides students with practical experience in applying innovative concepts to urban settings, focusing on enhancing sustainability, social equity, and economic development. A key project involves implementing Doughnut Economics principles in the Hoge Vucht neighborhood in Breda, in collaboration with a client from Breda University of Applied Sciences. This project aims to improve the neighborhood's social aspects by fostering community engagement and sustainability. The minor integrates diverse fields such as urban planning, economics, and social sciences, equipping students with the skills needed for sustainable and inclusive urban development.
roleDescription: Lead Developer - I was fully responsible for every part of the website and there were no other people involved.

title: Game Tournament
description: This gaming tournament website is a passion project developed for me and my brothers, designed to organize and manage our gaming tournaments for fun and enjoyment. Built with an integration of an Express.js API connected to a MongoDB database, the website allows all of us to contribute and enhance its functionality. It features capabilities to add new games, create and manage tournaments, and customize rules and scoring for each game. Our goal is to streamline the tournament organization process and enhance our gaming experiences through this interactive platform.
roleDescription: Lead Developer - I was fully responsible for every part of the website and there were no other people involved.

title: Hoge Vucht - Doughnut
description: This project is designed for a concept community platform to various activities and initiatives within the Hoge Vucht community. The website serves as an interactive platform where users can explore upcoming events, ongoing projects, and the positive impacts of Doughnut Economics in the neighborhood. It provides detailed information on each activity and Doughnut Economics. The site also includes features such as filtering and searching for specific activities, ensuring accessibility for all users. This platform aims to foster community involvement and collaboration, offering a user-friendly interface to navigate through the diverse offerings in Hoge Vucht.
roleDescription: Lead Developer - I was fully responsible for every part of the website and there were no other people involved.

title: AvansDevOps
description: This project is designed for personal testing purposes, serving as a platform to experiment with a variety of design patterns within the context of a DevOps system. It functions as a personal sandbox environment, allowing for hands-on exploration of different design patterns and their effects on the system. By using this sub-implementation, you can independently assess the practical implications and benefits of applying various design patterns in a DevOps context, without having to make an interface.
roleDescription: Lead developer - I was responsible for creating the application along with another student.

title: Easyflex - Internship
description: During my internship at Easyflex Software, I undertook a project aimed at enhancing the functionality of the Easyflex2Go (EF2GO) application. My focus was on expanding the inquiries, inquiries within Easyflex are basically job offers for employment agencies. Prior to my project, users had to switch in between the Easyflex and EF2GO application to do anything with the inquiries. My solution involved streamlining this process. This enabled the users to use the inquiries within EF2GO, and the data in between the two applications is kept up to date by running data synchronisations, so that the databases contain the same information.
roleDescription: Intern software developer - I was responsible for expanding upon the inquiries in the EF2GO application.

title: Het Leven in Handen
description: Het Leven in Handen is an immersive Unity game designed to provide policymakers with a unique perspective on the impact of Artificial Intelligence. Step into the shoes of an AI responsible for making critical decisions for Cardiovascular disease patients. Through a series of scenarios, players must carefully answer yes or no, knowing that each choice has significant consequences for patient well-being. Incorrect decisions lead to engaging CPR minigames, while correct choices unlock thrilling maze challenges. With its thought-provoking gameplay and strategic decision-making, this game offers policymakers an interactive experience to better understand the complexities of AI in healthcare.
roleDescription: Lead Developer - I was responsible for making a lot of game elements along with other students.

title: Cookie Clicker
description: This is a captivating 2D game developed in Unity for a thrilling Game Jam challenge. Step into the world of addictive confectionery as you embark on a cookie clicker adventure infused with gambling elements. Take risks, place bets, and aim to amass a fortune in delectable treats. The game's enticing mechanics offer an easy-to-learn, yet engaging experience, keeping players hooked for hours. With polished controls and immersive gameplay, Cookie Clicker will test your luck, strategy, and sweet tooth. Can you become the ultimate cookie tycoon in this addictive gambling extravaganza?
roleDescription: Developer - I was responsible for creating the game along with a project partner.

title: Shape Shooter
description: This 2D Unity game, developed using online tutorials, challenges players to shoot the correct shapes at incoming targets. The player must quickly identify the appropriate shape to fire in order to destroy various objects coming towards them. The game has a simple, addicting gameplay loop that's easy to pick up but hard to master. With the push of a button, players launch their ammo and rack up points while avoiding obstacles. With sharp visuals, intuitive controls, and a focus on skill-based gameplay, this 2D shooter is sure to provide a satisfying challenge for players of all levels.
roleDescription: Lead Developer - I was fully responsible for creating the game following tutorials.

title: Ghost Runner
description: This 2D game, created in Unity and built using online tutorials, places the player in the role of a ghost in an endless runner. With the goal of avoiding obstacles that litter the path ahead, the player must navigate through the game's challenging levels. The game's simple mechanics are easy to pick up, but challenging enough to keep players engaged. With responsive controls and a sharp focus on gameplay, this endless runner is sure to test both your reflexes and your wits.
roleDescription: Lead Developer - I was fully responsible for creating the game following tutorials.

title: Guarded Maze
description: This project involves creating a game in Unity where the player has to navigate a maze while avoiding obstacles to reach the end goal. The game development process involves following online tutorials to learn the basics of Unity game development, including designing game mechanics, coding, and designing 3D objects. The final product will be an entertaining and challenging game that tests players' problem-solving skills and ability to react quickly in order to avoid the obstacles and successfully navigate through the maze to reach the end goal.
roleDescription: Lead Developer - I was fully responsible for creating the game following tutorials.

title: Roll-a-Ball
description: This project involves creating a game in Unity where the player controls a ball that has to collect all of the collectibles within a given level to progress. The development process involves following online tutorials to learn the basics of Unity game development, including creating game objects, scripting game mechanics, and designing levels. The end product will be a fun and engaging game that challenges players to use their skills and strategy to navigate the ball through the obstacles and collect all of the items.
roleDescription: Lead Developer - I was fully responsible for creating the game following tutorials.

title: Ball.com
description: For Ball.com, a fake retailer going global, the project involved designing a system where customers can place orders from a pre-determined set of products. Orders are picked from a large warehouse, packaged, and sent using a logistics company selected by lowest price. Trusted third-party suppliers can add products. Customers can track order status and pay using forward- or after-payment. A service department answers customer queries. The system was designed using microservices architecture, event-driven communication, and eventual consistency to ensure scalability, maintainability, and efficiency.
roleDescription: Backend Developer - I was responsible for creating some parts of the microservices along with other people.

title: AI - Dominoes and Recognition
description: Appendix C requires creating a Dominoes game where an AI can be added. Three steps are involved: writing a generic domino engine, creating an adversary using a minimax algorithm, and playing without knowing the opponent's tiles. Appendix F requires developing an artificial neural network to recognize handwritten digits using the MNIST dataset. Different network topologies and input parameters are experimented with to see their effect. AUROC is the suggested evaluation function. Parameters include (hidden) layers, perceptrons, and activation function. Results are documented and explained.
roleDescription: Backend Developer - I was responsible for creating the algorithm and training the neural network with my project partner.

title: Portfolio
description: My portfolio website showcases all of my computer science projects, complete with detailed descriptions and information about the tools and technologies used in each project. Visitors can browse through the portfolio to gain a comprehensive understanding of my skills and experience in the field of computer science. The portfolio website serves as an excellent showcase of my technical abilities and dedication to the field of computer science.
roleDescription: Lead Developer - I was fully responsible for every part of the portfolio website and there were no other people involved.

title: The Circle
description: Inspired by 'The Circle' by Dave Eggers, our project had three components: a web platform for live streams and chat, an Android app for streaming and chat, and a backend server. Confidentiality was not allowed, so data was stored in plaintext and signed with a private key. RSASSA-PKCS1-v1_5 with SHA-256 was used for verification using the public key. Availability was not a concern, and scalability was a requirement. Our project team of four created the website for the live streams.
roleDescription: Scrum Master - I was responsible for creating the frontend for the web application and I was the scrum master, so I leaded the daily standups.

title: Data Science Portfolio
description: The Data Science portfolio assignment requires the use of Python on two online datasets to discover relationships and patterns. The portfolio will contain multiple assignments, each showcasing different data analysis techniques and methods. The projects will demonstrate the ability to manipulate and analyze data, visualize data, and draw insights from the results. The portfolio will serve as evidence of proficiency in data science and the ability to apply it to real-world problems. The final product will showcase a range of skills and knowledge in the field of data science.
roleDescription: Lead Developer - I was fully responsible for every part of the Python portfolio and there were no other people involved.

title: Project Kramse
description: The task is to convert Kramse's operational database and associated files to a data warehouse using SQL Server. The process involves extracting data from multiple sources, designing a star or snowflake schema, implementing the schema in SQL Server, populating the data warehouse with data, and designing one or more dashboards to meet Kramse's information needs. A product responsibility report detailing the choices made and the reasons behind them is required. The technical files necessary to build the data warehouse must also be included.
roleDescription: Lead Developer - I was fully responsible for every part of datawarehouses and dashboards and there were no other people involved.

title: Stel je Vraag LIVE! - CM.com
description: CM.com is based in Breda and develops a platform for mobile communication and payments used by customers worldwide. They offer solutions for SMS, WhatsApp, Viber, WeChat, Telegram, Facebook Messenger, Apple Business Chat, RCS, and innovative payment options. The company is looking for an online tool that allows visitors to log in and share questions during live presentations. The tool aims to solve the problem of the presenter not repeating questions asked by the audience. By using WebRTC technology, the presenter can hear the questions while the audience can also listen to the question asked.
roleDescription: Scrum Master - I was responsible for creating the front- and backend of the application, I leaded the daily standups and I contacted the stakeholder.

title: Dead by Daylight - Client
description: The individual project is to create a full stack single page web application with CRUD functionality on a chosen domain. The web application should have a client-side front-end, using web-based user interface and an API server. The server should use NoSQL databases for data storage. The project should have at least three entities with schema references and user authentication for editing and deleting entities. The system should be deployed online and have sufficient data to demonstrate its functionality.
roleDescription: Lead Developer - I was fully responsible for every part of the client-side website and there were no other people involved.

title: Fysioterapie - Server
description: This project aims to develop a web application using ASP.net MVC Core, applying a good application architecture and utilizing an automated development pipeline with unit testing and deployment. The project focuses on creating a practice management system for a new physiotherapy practice that Avans University is opening to support students and employees. The system will be used to manage patient records, appointments, and treatment plans. The development team will demonstrate the application and their design choices during the final assessment.
roleDescription: Lead Developer - I was fully responsible for every part of the server-side website and there were no other people involved.

title: Seeking Safety - KFZ
description: The Kwaliteit Forensische Zorg (KFZ) project aimed to develop a mobile application called 'Seeking Safety' for individuals with addiction problems and/or traumas. The application included the components of the 'Seeking Safety, Trauma and Addiction Handbook'. The project was developed using Android Studio, a popular integrated development environment (IDE) for Android app development. The app aimed to provide users with easy access to treatment plans for their addiction and trauma-related issues. The project was focused on improving the quality of care provided to individuals struggling with addiction and trauma in the forensic care sector.
roleDescription: Frontend Developer - I was responsible for designing an Android application along with 9 other developers.

title: Samen eten - Node.js API
description: In this project, a Node.js API with CRUD functionality was created to manage meals that can be prepared and delivered to student homes. The API was developed using modern software development practices and techniques, ensuring scalability and maintainability. The system provides easy management of meals, including creating, reading, updating, and deleting meals. The solution is designed to optimize the meal delivery process, making it more efficient and reducing the workload on staff. The project required expertise in Node.js, RESTful API design, and database management.
roleDescription: Lead Developer - I was fully responsible for every part of the Node.js API and there were no other people involved.

title: Davide Theatre - Android App
description: The Davide Theatre project involves creating an Android application that allows users to view information about movies using a public movie API. The application will display a list of available movies with their descriptions, ratings, and other relevant information. Users can select any movie to view more details and add it to their favorite list. The application is called Davide Theatre and is developed using Java and Android Studio. The aim of the project is to create a user-friendly, reliable, and efficient application for movie enthusiasts.
roleDescription: Frontend Developer - I was responsible for creating the Android application along with 4 other developers.

title: Breaking Bad - Android App
description: This project involves creating an Android application that features all the characters from the hit TV show Breaking Bad. The app will use a public API to retrieve information about each character and display it in an easy-to-use interface. The app will be designed to be used horizontally, allowing users to easily browse through the list of characters. Users will be able to search for characters by name and filter them by various criteria such as their role in the show or their affiliation with certain groups. The app will provide a fun and engaging way for fans of the show to explore the world of Breaking Bad.
roleDescription: Lead Developer - I was fully responsible for every part of the Android application and there were no other people involved.

title: Clockbuster - Webdesign
description: This project involved creating a movie website using HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, and Bootstrap. The goal was to create a visually appealing website that would showcase a variety of movies. Bootstrap was used to ensure that the website was mobile-responsive and user-friendly. The website includes multiple pages for different movie genres and features custom CSS styling to enhance the overall design. The project also involved implementing JavaScript to create interactive elements, such as a search function and movie trailers.
roleDescription: Lead Developer - I was fully responsible for every part of the webdesign and there were no other people involved.
